comment.text:
Delicious comfort food. Southern style. Where else can you get a bucket of fried chicken with amazing cocktails and a side of oysters? I'm waiting. 

As much as I try and branch out with avocado toast and some sweet brunch treats, I always fall back on the grilled cheese and tomato soup. 

Service is always spot on. Attentive but not overbearing. And the space is done well - if you want to watch a game, grab seats or a booth at the bar.

owner_replies.comment:
Yes! The grilled cheese is the go to especially now that its cooler outside. Thank you Nicole for taking the time to leave such a kind review, we hope to see you again soon. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
I live close enough to walk to this shopping center, so I was really excited when Roshambo opened. The vibe inside is cozy, but also classy. My boyfriend and I went for Valentine's Day last year and it was perfectly appropriate for a nice date night. 

The service is great. We usually sit at the bar and the bartenders have always been friendly, polite and knowledgeable. Definitely no complaints there! 

I'd say the food is *fine*. Good menu of diverse items and there's always something that I want to try, but nothing that I've eaten here really left such an impression on me that I went rushing back for more. The price point is in line with Atlanta restaurants...not exactly cheap. However, I did take off one star because on our most recent trip there, I got the Penne with Sausage and Peppers and that dish was memorable for being probably one of the worst things I've eaten in a restaurant. My boyfriend and I got a plate to share and between us, we couldn't eat the whole thing. The bartender noticed us picking at it and asked what was wrong. It had NO seasoning whatsoever. Even the sausage just tasted like unseasoned ground meat. To her credit, she kindly offered to bring us another one which we declined. We added salt but that didn't help and we ended up leaving half the dish uneaten. 

I'll definitely be back because I think this is a lovely spot with good cocktails and a pleasant vibe but I'm a little scared to spend another $25 on a dish that I can't even eat a quarter of.

Roshambo "The Diner's Diner"

Is easily located in the Peachtree Battle Shopping Plaza. If you're looking for a sign that says "Roshambo" you'll never find it...

Once inside you'll be pleasantly surprised by the chic decor. I don't want to give away too many details but it has an elevated feel to the space. 

Food - Hot, timely, and tasty...

Service - Impeccable. Hostesses and Staff were all friendly and accommodating. 

Ambiance - Think Upscale Diner (City Vibes)

owner_replies.comment:
Thank You Yaz for the kind review! And guess what we got a new sign, you have to come check it out. We hope to see you again soon. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
We had a brunch reservation for 5 at 11:30 am on Saturday, 12/16/23, for my friend's birthday. The restaurant had a party hat and a sweet little card on the table for her when we got there, which was such a nice touch! Dominic was our waiter and he was fabulous! "The Diner's Diner" was really misleading for me--without looking at pictures beforehand, I was expecting old-fashioned red booths and aluminum tables, but it was actually super upscale and nice inside.

Here's what I had:
- Cinnamon Monkey Bread ($9): OMG. I would go back just for this.
- Disco Tots ($14): Decent.
- Short Rib Hash ($24): This had good taste, but was missing crunch. I think it would've been better if the potatoes had been tater tots instead. I also asked for eggs over medium, but they came hard (not pictured--my friend's over easy eggs are pictured).

Fantastic service. Beautiful restaurant. Good food at a high price point.

Had an okay brunch here last weekend. We got there early so we were seated right away! The service was good and attentive, but the food was not our favorite. I got the French toast and it was underwhelming. The French toast didn't come with syrup and they charged extra for it. French toast should come with syrup :)

Great spot in the Peachtree Battle shopping center serving upscale comfort food. Roshambo has a very wide variety of options on their menu from tomato soup to mediterranean style chicken there's sure to be something for everyone. Came on a Thursday night with no reservations and were seated quickly! The servers were attentive and friendly and the food came out fairly fast. Fun fact: Roshambo used to be an old Turtle's records and tapes shop!

photos.caption: used to be an old Turtle's

comment.text: Fun restaurant located in Buckhead in the Peachtree plaza with public, Talbots, Pilates and much more. I've stopped by twice for brunch. I didn't have a reservation and was fine. Menu is delicious! Beyond an egg dish there aren't many traditional brunch options but the turkey, smoked fish, and everything else we tried was delicious. They also serve bottomless mimosas until 3. There are also specials when UGA plays for fans at the bar. Service has always been great.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind review Tari! We recently changed our menus and have a brunch menu on Saturday and Sunday now from 9-230pm! We hope to see you again soon. 

LINDSAY FERDINAND
General Manager

comment.text:
I'm a fan of Roshambo, or "the Diner's Diner" ...I love that there is a ton of parking since this is in a shopping plaza with a Publix. The ambience is actually quite elevated for a diner and they have a beautiful bar and fun little 2 person booths. The first time I came here was with a friend for happy hour (3-6pm) and the deals were amazing! Most of the cocktails were $10, I got an espresso martini and it was delicious. We also got oysters which were $10 per half dozen during happy hour. My friend got raw oysters and I got the charbroiled, which had all the good stuff (butter and bacon!). It's nice that the charbroiled oysters were included in the special since they usually aren't at other restaurants. 

I brought another friend here and we started with the crab rangoon dip ($14). As a crab rangoon enthusiast, this was everything I could have wanted! It came warm and melty with fried wonton chips. We were not super hungry, so we split the faux cheval burger ($19) and upgraded to disco tots. Our server knew we wanted to split the burger and brought it out to us cut in half on separate plates, which was very thoughtful. Everything was delicious, but I do feel like the price point is a little high if not coming for happy hour.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Faith, Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review of your experience. I am pleased to hear that our team made your experience pleasant and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
Chic upscale diner with a beautiful atmosphere. 

Service: I came twice within 2 weeks. The first time I was blown away with the impeccable service from both my waitress & bartender. Unfortunately, I failed to get their names :(... 

Food: I came on a Thursday & the meal of the day was they Spicy Crab Spaghettini. This dish was AMAZING & full of flavor. I also shared the disco tots, hushpuppies, fish tacos & the regular biscuit. The 2nd time I ordered the pasta & disco tots again. We also tried the Nashville Hot Chicken Biscuit. I have to admit that the disco tots & Spicy Crab Spaghettini weren't as tasty as the first time. It was clear that the chef was different. The tots barely had the delicious pimento cheese sauce on them so they were dry. The pasta was on the drier side as well. I was very disappointed. I would not reccomend the hushpuppies at all. They had no flavor at ALL. The aoili served with them was great, so order a side to dip your tots in. The Nashville hot chicken biscuit was nothing to write home about either. I would go back to try the pasta again. 

Drinks: Very good. All cocktails are $10 during happy hour

Parking: Ample. It's in a strip plaza

Overall, my experience was good. The restaurant is very aesthetic & the happy hour is very reasonable.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for your review, Larecia. We appreciate your positive feedback on our chic atmosphere and happy hour. We apologize for the inconsistencies in the food during your second visit and will discuss with our chef team so we can address these issues and make sure we are being consistent and delicious! Please dont hesitate to reach out to me directly if I can assist with your next reservation and show off the adjustments made to ensure our food is exactly what you were expecting. 
Lindsay Ferdinand
lindsay@roshamboatl.com
General Manager

comment.text:
It was nice to try this newer restaurant in the Peachtree Battle area. We had reservations, and a majority of tables were full on a Friday night. The space looks pretty modern and cool. Be sure to check out the cool tape wall on the way to the bathroom!

Although they refer to themselves as a diner's diner - it was not what we expected. Our server let us know that they're in the process of changing concepts - that was pretty obvious; they'll need to figure out what they want to be. There was one basic breakfast dish on the menu, but otherwise very little diner vibes. 

The food might be 4.5 stars on flavor. Our group tried a few things including the burger, winter kale salad, chicken parm, prime rib, and redfish (market fish) - as well as some cocktails and the skillet cookie. Everything was tasty. I enjoyed the salad but thought it could use a bit of nutty crunch or other texture. The burger was good albeit heavy on mayo. The fish and prime rib got great reviews from friends, the parm a bit less on sauce flavor. 

Service was fine but nothing to blow me away. No refills on water, etc. and rarely checked in before we were done. But very friendly when interacting with us, so perhaps busy manning a lot of tables. There was a large private party, which slowed down food service as well. 

All in all, would definitely return to try a few other dishes, and see how they find their identity too!

My sister and I decided to check out The Diner's Diner - Roshambo for their happy hour, which runs from Monday to Friday between 3-6 pm. The place caught my eye right away with its Atlanta-themed decor, featuring a mural of the cityscape on the right wall as you walk in. This mural is pretty unique, with three layers representing different snapshots taken from the Jackson Street Bridge on Freedom Parkway. The attention to detail was impressive.

Now, let's talk about the happy hour menu - it's got a nice variety of options, and the best part is that everything is priced at $10 or under. They've got cocktails, wine, and beer on offer, so there's something for everyone. I decided to go with the jalapeño margarita, and they made it nice and spicy just the way I like it. It hit the spot.

As for the food, I ordered the Nashville hot chicken biscuit, which came with pepper jack cheese, bourbon peach jam, chicken, house pickles, and shredded lettuce. It was really good. And the jalapeño cheddar hushpuppies with chili lime aioli were a tasty side.

My sister opted for the oysters and gave them a thumbs up.

They also have a free parking lot on site. 

The restaurant had a cute and cozy vibe with some thoughtful touches, and the service was solid.

All in all, The Diner's Diner - Roshambo is a winner in my book. It combines a bit of Atlanta charm, a well-priced happy hour menu, and good service. Definitely worth a visit!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Joy, thank you for your detailed review of The Diner's Diner - Roshambo! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your dining experience and hope to welcome you back soon for another visit!

comment.text: Aaron failed to adhere the happy hour rules. We had a group of 7 and he never credited the Happy Hour. He also stopped coming back to our table for an hour. Would not recommend if Aaron is your server.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for taking the time to review your dining experience with us. And I am so sorry that we dropped the ball and incorrectly charged your group. We will continue to coach our team on our different menus so this doesn't happen again. If willing I would love to have you back in to show you the dining experience you were looking forward to the first time. My email is lindsay@rohamboatl.com, If there's any additional details you wish to share or if I can personally assist with your next visit. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
SO excited for this restaurant. Local Three is a favorite and when I saw this menu I knew this restaurant was going to be a new go to.  Stopped by for brunch and the atmosphere is great. They have a long bar, several "high top" booths next to the bar and then the regular seating.  MAKE A RESERVATION. It wasn't hard to book a reservation a day out, but we had previously tried to call day of and they were on a 3 hour wait. 

I love the menu, which is why it pains me to say I didn't LOVE my meal. We had the pigs in a blanket to start (good, but we were both not crazy about the pairing of the sauce & opted to eat plain) Husband had the shrimp and grits which he enjoyed and I had the eggs benedict. Unfortunately the hollandaise had so much lemon in it and was too bitter to enjoy. I did try to rescue the ham underneath but left feeling pretty hungry. 

I know hollandaise is hard to nail, so i'll probably head back for another meal to try something else.  Granted, I think there are only ~4 brunch entrees so I may have to come back for dinner instead.

A very cute restaurant hidden away in a shopping plaza in buckhead. Ample parking here and I don't think it gets too busy so you may not need a reservation. I had made one just in case.

We went here for brunch and were seated immediately. The decor in here is very quirky and well thought out. I will say the room we were seated in had a lot of sound being trapped in so it was kind of hard to hear. 

I ordered a coffee which was pretty decent and the grilled cheese with tomato soup. I enjoyed it but might have preferred a different bread. It's really nice that you can order from the breakfast lunch and dinner menu at any time. 

The service is decent too, it took a little bit longer to get our check, but that was ok. I would come back to try some other things on the menu.
We came Thursday before New Years 2023. I got the Thursday special of pork schnitzel. Looks great and great service!

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind review Jordan! We hope to see you again soon. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text: I'm giving this restaurant five stars because my husband absolutely loved it and cannot stop talking about it. I, unfortunately, had a cold while we were there, so I can't fairly access it. We had the biscuits, I had a fall salad with steak, and he had the shrimp with cauliflower grits, and he loved it. The host was very nice, our waitress was fine, and it was a pleasant enough experience.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Rayelle! Thank you so much for your 5-star review. We're thrilled that your husband enjoyed his meal and had a great experience. We hope to have you back in when you're feeling better so you can enjoy the full experience. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
This is a new spot, been open since thanksgiving 2022. It's a chic diner that serves all day all menu (bfast, lunch and dinner) I needed something for Valentine's Day brunch without a pre fix menu and this place delivered! The ambience is super nice, with art reflecting ATL skyline. I love the theme and they also have a decor wall
With old cassette. The server was very enthusiastic and captured all the specials. The fish tacos and chicken pot pie were fantastic. Tuna poke crudo was a great appetizer. The lobster enchilada not so much and was steep at 50$ for the quality. It also could work on the presentation. The mimosa was served in a wine glass??? But the poncietta was great. 
3 stars as 2 out of our 5 dishes were subpar and not good at all.

photos.caption: A little bit abt the restaurant. Good read
Drinks. Poncietta was better than mimosa
French toast. Very forgettable. Would Not Reorder
Our table was ready with reservatjons
Chicken pot Pie with salad. My friends loved this. An odd presentation but the flavors were good

comment.text:
Amazing food. Amazing ambience. Amazing service. 

Came here for my gunny's birthday. We had Cierra as our waitress and she was amazing l! Met us with a lovely smile and made sure all our food came out on time 

We were a party of five and had the bucket of chicken and bubbles and lots of apps. My recommendation  is to get one bucket. And eat the apps. It was worth it for a big party. It's a whole bird cut and and deep fried. Was more than enough! 

It's only been open a couple of weeks. So go check it out!!

Came here for brunch with another Atlanta Yelp Elite as this place just recently opened. It's located in the Peachtree Battle shopping center with plenty of free parking. Beware, pulling up I was looking for a "Roshambo" sign, but it's rather signed "Diner's Diner". 

The interior and aesthetic is stunning. Amazing vibes and so meticulously curated. It really doesn't fit the location and walking inside is a true surprise. We had a reservation and were seated quickly.

I ordered the Double Stack Burger ($19) and my friend ordered the Four Cheese Grilled Cheese ($18). I really enjoyed my burger and it was juicy and delectable. The tots were plentiful and nice as they weren't your normal mass produced tater tots you get in the frozen section at Kroger, but still normal tots haha. My friend enjoyed her grilled cheese and soup as well.

Maybe it was the location we were sitting in here that echoes or the company close by, but this place gets LOUD in the worst way possible. I don't fault the restaurant as pretty sure it was the table next by yelling. This could have been better handled by staff as I could barely hear my friend beside me. 

Service was really good until we finished our meal and then it seemed like we could never flag down our waiter or see him? I guess this wasn't an issue, but we were ready to get our checks and head on out. BUT, we never felt rushed at all! Once we flagged him down, all was back on track.

We had a group reservation for 4 on a Sunday evening and as soon as we checked in l, we were seated.  The atmosphere of the new restaurant is very nice, it's well lit with a causal yet fine dining vibe.  There's plenty of booths and tables with dividers, as well as a bar with TVs, to not feel overcrowded.
We split the disco tots which were a fun twist with the melted pimento cheese.
All the entrees were a generous size and appropriately priced in my opinion, most of us didn't finish our plate.  I had the shrimp and grits which had a twist using hatch chiles which was delicious.
The wine/beer/cocktail menu reminds me of their other restaurants - they offer a wide variety of wines and handmade cocktails, with a few select beers.
Finally, 5+ stars for service - they had ample staff to assist with refilling waters, taking away plates, and serving.  Everyone was very courteous!

There a new swanky diner in town!!! And I mean swanky!!!!!!! I love the Muss and Turner and Local Three folks so I couldn't wait to try Roshambo! Oh and you're welcome to play rock, paper, scissors...go and find out more. 

They serve, you guessed it, breakfast. lunch and dinner daily (until 9pm or 10pm Deb ending in the day)

The food is not typical but yet it is. It's elevated. The bar is huge and I enjoyed my espresso martini.  

Parking: Easy! It's located in the Peachtree battle shopping center. 

Great space. Bring a date. Bring your girls. RSVP available via open table.

Much more than a diner... Fabulous eclectic new spot in Peachtree Battle. Long beautiful bar... Menu is almost perfect... Breakfast,Lunch, Dinner avail all day... I got the Eggs Benedict for dinner! Delicious.. My friend got the fish tacos.  The Shrimp and Grits looked amazing ( i was peeking at the next table)
Decor is quite unique, bathrooms are modern and everything is spotless.  Will definitely be back. 
* Also, ordered a special martini with Jalapenos in it, and bartender made it perfect , also went out of her way to make sure I liked it..

My review is only for the bar and drinks, as that is all I had. A friend and I stopped here for a nightcap in July 2023. We picked a seat, and the friendly bar staff immediately greeted us. I absolutely loved the map on the mirror behind the bar. This place has a very elegant but comfortable feel; the barstools are super soft with backs, and there are two different height footrests. I get really annoyed when I get to a bar, and there's nothing to lean against, and there's no comfortable place to rest my feet.  
The restaurant is decorated with the Atlanta skyline on one wall, an honorary wall to the old Turtles record store, and many other pictures of moments in Atlanta's history. I liked everything I saw on the way to the bathroom so much that I was very tempted to walk around the whole restaurant so I wouldn't miss anything, but I decided not to since I needed to come back and try their food. 
We enjoyed our first round so much that we had a second.  The bar has an outstanding selection of liquor, especially whiskey. My first drink was a Bee's Knees, which was perfectly balanced; if not made well, Bee's Knees are very sweet. My friend had the French 75, and she liked it so much that she had a second one. For my second drink, I had a NY sour, which is something that I've never tried before, and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Wall on the way to the bathroom- did you ever make it to a Turtles?
Love map on the bar mirror

owner_replies.comment: We appreciate the review, Carrie. Thanks for taking the time.  You will have to come back and check out the summer cocktails that will be added to the menu next week! We hope to see you again soon.

comment.text:
I would think this place would have more reviews. Came here for brunch and was pleased. Started with a (very) boozy mimosa (LOVE THAT!) and a cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll was warm and not too gooey. 

For my entree I got the popular Double Stacker + fried egg. The burger was well seasoned and the tots touched my soul. 

Along with my entree I ordered a Bloody Mary which was properly spicy and flavorful. 

Service was warm and attentive. The overall decor and vibe of the place is southern, yet modern with a splash of funk (you can spot random song lyrics through out the decor). Definitely a good spot for girls brunch.

photos.caption: Double Stack Burger (+ fried egg) and Tots

comment.text:
I can't hype this place up enough. From the atmosphere and food, to the amazing service, Roshambo checks every box. I saw the Chicken Bucket on IG and had to try it, and it did not disappoint. Some of the best fried chicken I've had in ATL, paired with some of amazing biscuits and sides. 

How could I forget the drinks! Drinks are always pricy in Atlanta, but the Cosmo Pitcher is a solid deal. They also have a great Happy Hour selection, which is hard to find in Buckhead. 

10/10, no notes. Love this place and will be back soon!
Upscaled diner with solid food and great cocktails. Definitely worth a visit and kid friendly!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you Mith. We hope to see you again soon .

comment.text: Love the ambiance, which is a testament to Atlanta history in upscale design yet welcoming vibe. Service is always 10/10. Menu has variety and is great for a group. Excellent bar service and drink options as well. Happy to be regulars at this local favorite spot.

This restaurant is beautiful.  It's a cross between a fancy restaurant, sexy bar and diner vibes.  We came for late breakfast and no one was there.  
The menu had 4 breakfast options. Not alot of choice for a restaurant that says it's a diner.  Also $21 for eggs?  

Then we learned you can order the entire menu so we ordered dinner which also has 4 options.

Trout
Pork

Overall the food is good and the portion was sizable. But this place is expensive for what it claims to be - a diner. Also there is just not many options.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Rene. We're glad you enjoyed the atmosphere and decor at Roshambo. We understand that it's frustrating when your dollar doesn’t seem to stretch as far as it used to. While we can’t speak for others, Partner Chris Hall has written an explanation for why our prices are what they are. We pride ourselves on transparency, and hope this helps you understand our prices. Follow the link below to read. 

We hope to see you at Roshambo soon.

http://unsukay.com/info/pricing/

comment.text: I will say this place is unassuming being in a strip mall but it's much more than meets the external eye. I truly hope this place succeeds as it's the best service (thank you Ciara) I've had in Atlanta in the 10 years of being here. They properly clear between courses, are knowledgably about the menu, and friendly. I tried the brussels, burger, trout, chicken parm, and the skillet cookie and all were absolutely delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant for the service, food, and unique décor.

Pretty restaurant but hard to have a group larger than 3 around the bar b/c the space is very skinny. Also, menu is way too limited in you are not into breakfast foods. Need more salad-type options and healthy sides.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for taking the time to leave honest feedback from your experience with us.  Im not sure the last time you visited but we now offer 3 distinct menus in order to provide our guests more options, Lunch, Dinner and Brunch which is available Sat & Sun from 9-3. We hope you will join us again.  Feel free to reach out to me directly if I can ever be of assistance with a reservation or menu question. My email is lindsay@roshamboatl.com

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text:
Nice food and drinks, fantastic staff.

Biggest gripe: there was a 90 minute limit on our table and there was no mention of that online or at any time during check in. Having said that, the lady who checked on us at the end was extremely kind in giving us this notification. But seriously, someone give a heads up ahead of time.

The redfish was flavored perfectly and the accompanying sauce was nice but the grit cake fell flat. I get the containment that the grit cake provides but usually it ends up being a dense puck and underflavored. My friend had the pork which he devoured and we started with the brussels sprouts which were tasty.

Drinks were good and the ambience was very nice. The menu looks great and I'll definitely be back to sample some more items, especially the fried chicken bucket.

The rest of the staff was equally hospitable which made for a pleasant evening.

I was visiting a friend in Atlanta and we wanted a delicious breakfast to start the day...and we were so impressed. The ambiance is amazing - loved the quirky taxidermy up front and the cool tape wall in the back (apparently they used to sell tapes at the location back in the day!) The mimosas were perfect (plenty of champagne) and the omelette....oh my goodness. The cheese in the omelette was seriously sublime. The portions are a really good size, as well-I wasn't even able to finish my omelette (and I eat quite a bit normally). Highly recommend a visit.

photos.caption: The omelette was to die for...the Boursin
A really cool tape wall in the back of the restaurant

comment.text:
I don't know what I expected but this wasn't it. I was pleasantly surprised on this modern take on a diner. From the decor to the service and food, everything was lovely. 

We waited for our table at the bar. Our server came over to introduce herself and take drink orders while we waited for our table. All of your favorite classics are right on the menu. (So no praying for a good Bee's Knees or Sazarac, they've got it mastered) 

Megan was the wonderful server that I mentioned earlier. Her energy is magnetic with a smile to match. She offered great service, recommendations and even took our picture! I'd come back just for her ! 

We had the spinach and onion dip which tastes very very similar to the classic spinach and artichoke dip. Then we shared fish tacos and chicken parm. I've never enjoyed plain noodles so much!! Like seriously.  

10/10 recommend.

Came here after church on a sunday (around 2pm). Apparently it's pretty new and has breakfast food so I was excited to come and see what they had to offer.

Not that many breakfast options so I ended up going  with the double stack burger. The portion size was good and the burger was quite juicy.

The service was pretty friendly although they weren't as informed about the menu options as I would've liked. Overall a great experience and I'd give them another try in the future.

Loved it!  I had the filet and my wife had the blackened catch of the day, Arctic Char.  We shared bites of each and both were delicious.  My steak was a perfect medium rare.  Our server, David, was fantastic and the decor was really cool.   

As a bonus, I loved the vintage pictures of Dale Murphy and R.E.M. on the walls!  One other thing, it's nice for once to go somewhere where it's a piece of cake to park.

We will certainly return.

Went for a date night with the wife. Extensive drink menu. Wine and cocktails aplenty. Low lighting and a really chill vibe. Would definitely recommend. Wife got the Trout and I ordered the Crispy Fish Tacos.

Rude. like it was a burden for me to bring 18 people there on a Wednesday night (their website says We'd. are not busy) and I called to confirm they did not have any reservations in the side hustle. I told them a month before there would be at most 20 people. I was told conflicting info. 

This was a gathering of parents from a school nearby, most live within 10 minutes of the restaurant and not to mention work nearby. A huge misstep as they could have welcomed us and gotten tons of repeat business but they  treated us like we were a burden. so rude. the manager's statements and tone to us extremely unprofessional!

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We always appreciate hearing from our guests, as it helps us improve our services and ensure the best possible experience for everyone.

I'm sorry to hear about the confusion surrounding your recent visit. We understand that large parties can be challenging to coordinate, and we sincerely apologize if there was any miscommunication about our Side Hustle minimums and needing a credit card to hold the reservation. We offered your group a much lower minimum for the night and when asked to put a credit card on file to hold the reservation were refused as well when that is a policy we have for taking the entire private dining room for an evening. Booking multiple reservations under false pretenses affects our ability to staff the restaurant accordingly as we aren't able to rotate and share reservations equally amongst our team.

At our restaurant, we have established these guidelines to ensure that we can provide the highest level of service and accommodate the needs of larger groups effectively,  including scheduling extra staff to efficiently serve larger groups. We strive to maintain a balance between catering to the unique needs of each guest and the operational requirements of our establishment. 
To better address situations like this in the future, we will work on improving our communication with guests, especially when it comes to large party reservations. We aim to provide clear information about our policies and help guests understand the expectations to avoid any inconvenience and maintain the level of service we strive to provide to all our guests.  I would love to discuss further if you are willing. My email is Lindsay@roshamboatl.com. 

Lindsay Ferdinand
General Manager

comment.text: My lovely bride and I have ordered takeout a couple of times, and we enjoy their food. Service is friendly and helpful, and parking is convenient. We like the chicken pot pie (although next time we should dine in for this dish), mezze platter, the double stack burger, and the brussel sprouts. The chopped salad didn't travel well, and the fish tacos were just okay. We do love their four cheese grilled cheese sandwich, served with Grandma's tomato soup.

So me and Nancy decided to head to Atlanta for a nice couples trip and along our travels we decided to try Roshambo on a whim.  First we were greeted by a wonderful host by the name of James who was proudly wearing his Falcons jersey even though in Arlen, we live and breathe Dallas Cowboys.  He was probably the warmest and nicest host I have encountered in quite some time.  The last time I got greeted this nice was when Kahn and the Souphanousinphones thought I was moving out of my house.  Once we sat at our table we were then greeted with a helpful waitress and the whole time we were greeted with amazing 70s music that set the ambiance.  Also the cassette wall next to the bathroom was a great touch!  But then we start getting our food and the bread was amazing! Then I decided to get the shrimp and grits with pumpkin ( I know sounds a lil wonky)  which was different but familiar at the same time and very good.  Hank called me while I was in the restaurant and I told him he had to come, he then just kept talking my head off about Ladybird.  I always say the details of a restaurant matter and that was seen in the cleanliness of the bathroom and even their own branded plates which were amazing.  Ahhh dare I say is Roshambo one of the best restaurants in Atlanta.  Idk what restaurant could contend with them.  Between the warmth of the staff and the quality of the food it made me more satisfied than when Bobby eats a warm fruit pie.  I guess back to Arlen.....

Food and service were very good.. unfortunately we were sat in the back close to the kitchen where some kind of an altercation broke out .."F" this F'ing this and that". ...we were finishing up and heard this. A man walked out from the kitchen and I asked if everything was ok? .. he responded with "YEAH! but we're fixin to LEAVE! " ... not what was I was expecting.. bad ending to a nice dinner. Next time .. if there is one .. maybe we ask to be seated away from the kitchen..
we had avocado toast and oysters for apps , steak and pork tenderloin for mains, 2 old fashions to start and a nice Borolo with dinner .. all top notch .. maybe the pork was a tad dry but overall a very nice meal

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Beth, thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your kind words about the food and service and have noted your seating preference for next time. We appreciate your concern and alerting us to a possible issue, I am so sorry for the commotion near the kitchen and want to reassure you that there was no altercation between our staff last evening, a team member hit their shin on a large pot which caused a few choice words due to the initial pain but they are ok now, just a bruise. Please dont hesitate to reach out if I can be of any additional assistance now or in the future.  
Lindsay Ferdinand 
General Manager 
Lindsay@roshamboatl.com

comment.text:
We recently had dinner on a Saturday night. And they made accommodations for us to eat in the bar area. The food was delicious, we loved our server. She provided excellent service, and it's a really beautiful space.  You would never know such a wonderful restaurant was tucked away in the Peachtree Battle Shopping Center. 
 
It's definitely going to be the local neighborhood diner.

This restaurant is one of my top 10 favorite spots in the city.  I'm ashamed to say that I have tried every appetizer on the menu but the spinach & artichoke dip and that's only because artichokes make the back of my throat itch.  I have the appetizers in order, starting with the most delicious, Jalapeno Cheddar Hushpuppies, Disco Tots, the broiled oyster and Brussel Sprouts.  The staple menu items that I would recommend is Chicken Parmesan, Seared Georgia Mountain Trout, That Double Stack Burger (My Goodness) and the Georgia Peach French Toast.  I must make a confession, I'm black.  Now that the jig is up let's talk about the Bucket O Chicken, it's just ok. I think it's a good appetizer for a group, the sauces they serve and the cool bucket it comes in are a bonus.  The crab & avocado toast includes a lot of crab but the lemon sauce is a distraction. 

Best waiter : Dominique 
Ambiance :  Amazing...every room is different.

owner_replies.comment: Jason, thank you for your amazing review of our restaurant! We're thrilled to hear that you've enjoyed our menu and ambiance. We appreciate your honest feedback on the Fried Chicken and crab & avocado toast. We hope to serve you again soon!

comment.text:
After seeing Eater mention Roshambo multiple times, I had to try it out. The concept of an elevated diner calls to my soul. The decor is incredible pairing a bit of whimsy with Atlanta. The cassette tape wall is such a neat touch. And the service was just as great. BUT...

The food is just okay if not underwhelming. Fish tacos were bland and not much better than I have had at chains. The salsa was abysmal and the chips about the same. The brussels sprouts were pretty good, so I'll give them that.  For spending $30-40/person, I expected much better food. With the plethora of incredible options in Atlanta, I would pass on this one until the food matches the effort put into the decor.

owner_replies.comment: Zora, Thank you for taking the time to leave this review about your recent experience at Roshambo. Im glad to hear you had great service and Im so sorry that the food did not live up to  expectations.  I will share this with our chef team so they can address where needed with our team.  We strive to create memorable experiences for our guests and Im so sorry that you didn't get the meal you were hoping for. We are making a few changes over the next week to the menu and I hope you will give us another shot. Please reach out to me at lindsay@roshamboatl.com if I can ever be of assistance in the future.

comment.text: Food was good. Service was good. Ample parking. I had fish tacos, flounder. Chicken bucket was the bomb. Daughter loved the Parmesan chicken. Lobster rolls special was good too. Only thing not a hit was cornbread pancakes. Who ever heard of cornbread pancakes?  Didn't taste them...person who ordered them didn't eat them. I'm going back. Good lighting and not crowded.

Food was to delicious and tasted so fresh! Our server took time to explain everything on the menu. The ambiance was spectacular, lighting, decor, atmosphere was complimentary to the food, can't recomend this place enough!

photos.caption: Omelette was to so yum! the tater tots were even better! the grilled cheese was buttered and smothered in cheese, the soup tasted so fresh.
lighting is so cool! They were magnetic rope lights?!
They even gave me a personalized card, signed by each team member! This was so unique and thoughtful!

comment.text: Came here for a spontaneous brunch and WOW it did not disappoint. It's very rare that *every* dish is equally yummy. The service staff was totally on point and the inside is nothing like you'd expect, VERY cool interior design. Highly recommend and will for sure be back again!

I came here for brunch with my siblings this past sunday, i had a great time! we ordered the disco tots to start, they were crispy and good. And for lunch I had the georgia peach french toast and when i tell you i am still thinkng bout it, HOOOOMYGAWD! I am so excited to com back in september!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind review. We cant wait to see you in September!

comment.text: Fabulous double stack and tots, really nice ambiance (don't let the diner moniker fool ya - it's a lovely place), kind and attentive staff. Highly recommend!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind review Julie! We hope to serve you again soon.

comment.text:
This place is called a diners-Diner. 
Such a fitting title. 
The food was descent, with great drinks (fresh squeezed juices) and pleasant customer service. 
Parking is no issue and the bathrooms are clean. 
I would recommend making a reservation for weekend dining.

What a great addition to the neighborhood.  I am already excited about my return. The special this evening was a prime rib French dip and it was very good.  I love the bread they use.  My friend had the burger and we split our entrees. The burger is my second favorite in Atlanta.  It was perfectly cooked and the bun was great.  Next time I will order it with the toppings on the side as to enjoy the flavor of the burger more. The old fashion that I had was absolutely perfect.  Our server was very friendly and helpful.  My only suggestion is in the evening to turn the lights down a bit to enjoy the relaxing environment that they have made.  Oh did I mention breakfast, lunch and dinner all day?  I am happy they are in our neighborhood.

photos.caption: Old Fashion and prime rib French dip
